result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin D Blanchard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Ron Benavides.

Defendant Justin D Blanchard in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called: 14CF402, & 14CF328. Victim gave statement to the court. Sentencing recommendations argued. Defendant made statement. Court sentenced the defendant in 14CF328 to serve 6 years in prison, 3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision, consecutive to any other sentence currently serving. In 14CF402 Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 years in prison, 3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision, consecutive to  any other case currently serving.   Conditions of extended supervision on both cases include: Submit DNA sample, No contact with E.U., her children, her family, and work place, schools, daycare, and residences. Complete domestic abuse counseling, and anger management counseling, AODA and comply with any treatment recommended. No dating or sexual relationships without prior approval from agent. Maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant is not eligible for the challenge incarceration program or substance abuse program.  9 days jail credit 14CF402.  10:35/11:35
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 23, 2018 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: 2:50 pm  Defendant, Justin D Blanchard, appeared. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Argument by defendant.  State brought to the attention of the Court that defendant is only serving probation on this case, in14CF289 the defendant was to serve jail as a condition of probation.  State objected to furlough.  Victim is present.  Victim gave statement.  Court denied the motion for furlough.  2:59 pm.

Cases called: 14CF289, 14CF402, 14C327, 14CF328,  Defendant Justin D Blanchard in court, in custody, with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PSI addressed. Sentencing statements made by the parties. Court addressed defendant regarding sentencing.  In 14CF289, Court withheld sentence, placed defendant on 3 yrs. probation, conds: 1 year jail - serve six months, starting 9/1/15. Huber granted for work and counseling sessions. Remaining six months stayed - to be used at agent's discretion. $618 costs, Further conds: Become involved in counseling program as soon as possible. Successfully complete anger management & domestic abuse counseling.   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. (3 days jail credit).  In 14CF327, sentence withheld, 2 yr. probation, conds. as in 14CF289 with exception of jail and DNA sample, $543 costs. (86 days jail credit)  In 14CF328, sentence withheld, 3 yr. probation, same conds. as in 14CF327, $618 costs (86 days jail credit)  In 14CF402, sentence withheld, 3 yr. probation, same conds. as in 14CF327 $618 costs (9 days jail credit).

Cases heard: 14CF289, 14CF327, 14CF328, 14CF402, Defendant Justin D Blanchard in court, in custody with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Waivers of Preliminary Hearings filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Informations filed. In 14CF327 & 14CF328, Atty. Klopp motioned for reduction of cash bonds and removal of no contact with E.U. Statement given by victim. DA Kohlwey objected to motion. Court amended bonds to $2,000 each case for a total of $4,000. No contact continued.  Arraignment scheduled for November 18, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
